text: Shh 45 years ago Martin Luther King
delivered his I have a dream speech to
nearly 300,000 people gathered near the
Lincoln Memorial in Washington DC i am
michael powell a reporter for The New
York Times as Barack Obama prepares to
give his acceptance speech at the
Democratic National Convention I set out
to talk to delegates who had
participated in the civil rights
movement seeking their views on the long
journey from then to today desi woods
Jones was drawn south to fight for civil
rights once she dreamed the change would
come immediate and fast 40 years ago I
was probably naive enough to believe yes
that I would see some of those changes
occur to what extent I had no idea you
know when you're young
we thought we were going to change the
world tomorrow it's like where we are
aware of young revolutionaries we are
marching in the street where you know
change is happening and yes
overwhelming
exciting time to see America America
moved to this point in our life America
to move toward a serious female
candidate America to embrace an
african-american on a real level I hope
and I pray that we are past that but
we're past that fear that we look at
what's best for the country and the best
leadership for the country this time and
again you know there are people as you
say that certainly agree with the
philosophy mackanin have every right
them to support him but there are those
that don't and I think those that don't
if they will just follow their causes
and both broke the person that they
really think is going to change this
country then Brock will end up being our
new president that issue there were like
Archie spigner a retired councilman from
Queens New York reflects back to the
early 1960s there was a national
movement in the black community of
activism time for a change you've heard
that yes there were those of us who were
challenging the white leadership we had
black caucuses and we and we were called
all kinds of names you know the status
for people there's no doubt that in race
relations we have made significant
progress economic progress social
progress neither Archie nor does he
dreamed that one day they might cast a
ballot for an african-american president
